verses.verse: "Why <S%H6256>aren't<s%> times laid up <S%H6845>by<s%> the <S%H7706>Almighty?<s%> Why <S%H3045>don't<s%> those who know him <S%H2372>see<s%> his <S%H3117>days?<s%>
There are people who <S%H5381>remove<s%> the <S%H1367>landmarks.<s%> They violently take <S%H1497>away<s%> <S%H5739>flocks,<s%> and feed <S%H7462>them.<s%>
They drive <S%H5090>away<s%> the <S%H2543>donkey<s%> of the <S%H3490>fatherless,<s%> and they <S%H2254>take<s%> the <S%H490>widow<s%>'s <S%H7794>ox<s%> for a <S%H2254>pledge.<s%>
They <S%H5186>turn<s%> the <S%H34>needy<s%> out of the <S%H1870>way.<s%> The <S%H6041>poor<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%> <S%H3162>all<s%> hide <S%H2244>themselves.<s%>

<S%H6501>Behold,<s%> as wild donkeys in the <S%H4057>desert,<s%> they go <S%H3318>forth<s%> to their <S%H6467>work,<s%> seeking <S%H7836>diligently<s%> for <S%H2964>food.<s%> The <S%H6160>wilderness<s%> yields them <S%H3899>bread<s%> for their <S%H5288>children.<s%>
They <S%H7114>cut<s%> their <S%H1098>provender<s%> in the <S%H7704>field.<s%> They <S%H3953>glean<s%> the <S%H3754>vineyard<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>
They lie all <S%H3885>night<s%> <S%H6174>naked<s%> without <S%H3830>clothing,<s%> and have no <S%H3682>covering<s%> in the <S%H7135>cold.<s%>
They are <S%H7372>wet<s%> with the <S%H2230>showers<s%> of the <S%H2022>mountains,<s%> and <S%H2263>embrace<s%> the <S%H6697>rock<s%> for lack of a <S%H4268>shelter.<s%>
There are those who <S%H1497>pluck<s%> the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%> from the <S%H7699>breast,<s%> and take a <S%H2254>pledge<s%> of the <S%H6041>poor,<s%>
So that they <S%H1980>go<s%> around <S%H6174>naked<s%> without <S%H3830>clothing.<s%> Being <S%H7457>hungry,<s%> they <S%H5375>carry<s%> the <S%H6016>sheaves.<s%>
They make <S%H6671>oil<s%> <S%H996>within<s%> the <S%H7791>walls<s%> of these <S%H1869>men.<s%> They tread wine <S%H3342>presses,<s%> and suffer <S%H6770>thirst.<s%>

From out of the populous <S%H5892>city,<s%> <S%H4962>men<s%> <S%H5008>groan.<s%> The <S%H5315>soul<s%> of the <S%H2491>wounded<s%> cries <S%H7768>out,<s%> yet <S%H433>God<s%> <S%H7760>doesn't<s%> regard the <S%H8604>folly.<s%>
"These are of those who <S%H4775>rebel<s%> against the <S%H216>light.<s%> They <S%H5234>don't<s%> know its <S%H1870>ways,<s%> nor <S%H3427>stay<s%> in its <S%H5410>paths.<s%>
The <S%H7523>murderer<s%> <S%H6965>rises<s%> with the <S%H216>light.<s%> He <S%H6991>kills<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H6041>needy.<s%> In the <S%H3915>night<s%> he is like a <S%H1590>thief.<s%>

The <S%H5869>eye<s%> also of the <S%H5003>adulterer<s%> <S%H8104>waits<s%> for the <S%H5399>twilight,<s%> <S%H559>saying,<s%> <S%H5869><s%> 'No eye shall <S%H7789>see<s%> <S%H5643>me.<s%>' He disguises his <S%H6440>face.<s%>
In the <S%H2822>dark<s%> they dig <S%H2864>through<s%> <S%H1004>houses.<s%> They <S%H2856>shut<s%> themselves up in the <S%H3119>daytime.<s%> They <S%H3045>don't<s%> know the <S%H216>light.<s%>
For the <S%H1242>morning<s%> is to all of them <S%H3162>like<s%> thick <S%H6757>darkness,<s%> for they <S%H5234>know<s%> the <S%H1091>terrors<s%> of the thick <S%H6757>darkness.<s%>

"They are <S%H7031>foam<s%> on the surface of the <S%H6440>waters.<s%> Their <S%H2513>portion<s%> is <S%H7043>cursed<s%> in the <S%H776>earth.<s%> They <S%H6437>don't<s%> turn into the <S%H1870>way<s%> of the <S%H3754>vineyards.<s%>
<S%H6723>Drought<s%> and <S%H2527>heat<s%> <S%H1497>consume<s%> the <S%H7950>snow<s%> <S%H4325>waters,<s%> so does <S%H7585>Sheol<s%> those who have <S%H2398>sinned.<s%>

The <S%H7358>womb<s%> shall <S%H7911>forget<s%> <S%H7415>him.<s%> The worm shall feed <S%H4988>sweetly<s%> on <S%H2142>him.<s%> He shall be no more remembered. <S%H5766>Unrighteousness<s%> shall be <S%H7665>broken<s%> as a <S%H6086>tree.<s%>
He <S%H7462>devours<s%> the <S%H6135>barren<s%> who <S%H3205>don't<s%> bear. He shows no <S%H3190>kindness<s%> to the <S%H490>widow.<s%>
Yet God <S%H4900>preserves<s%> the <S%H47>mighty<s%> by his <S%H3581>power.<s%> He rises <S%H6965>up<s%> who has no <S%H539>assurance<s%> of <S%H2416>life.<s%>
God <S%H5414>gives<s%> them <S%H983>security,<s%> and they <S%H8172>rest<s%> in <S%H5869>it.<s%> His eyes are on their <S%H1870>ways.<s%>

They are <S%H7426>exalted;<s%> yet a little <S%H4592>while,<s%> and they are <S%H4355>gone.<s%> Yes, they are brought low, they are taken <S%H7092>out<s%> of the <S%H1870>way<s%> as all <S%H5243>others,<s%> and are cut off as the <S%H7218>tops<s%> of the ears of <S%H7641>grain.<s%>
If it <S%H645>isn't<s%> so now, who will <S%H7760>prove<s%> me a <S%H3576>liar,<s%> and <S%H7760>make<s%> my <S%H4405>speech<s%> worth <S%H408>nothing?<s%>"
